Socialism in DPRK Praised in Brazil 
    Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- A political decision was adopted at the 11th Congress of the Brazilian Communist Party held between Oct. 20 and 23.
 The political decision was titled "The revamped party, independent and democratic Brazil and socialism is future".    
It said: The U.S. imperialists left no stone unturned to remove all traces of socialism from the surface of earth after socialism was frustrated in the former Soviet Union and east European countries at the end of the 20th century but socialism is now alive and making progress in the DPRK and other countries under the leadership of the revolutionary parties. This is instilling strong confidence and courage into the progressive people struggling for socialism.
 The U.S. imperialists have persistently pursued a hostile policy towards the DPRK after deploying huge forces of aggression and nukes in south Korea but socialism is winning victory after victory in the DPRK as the days go by. This reality brings strong hope for socialism to the world progressive forces.

articles.title: U.S. Anti-DPRK Human Rights Racket under Fire
articles.content:
Punishment of GI Criminals Urged in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- The Youth and Students Solidarity of south Korea to Implement the June 15 South-North Joint Declaration reportedly issued a statement on Oct. 28 calling upon the youths and students to turn out in the struggle for repealing the SOFA imposed upon south Korea by the U.S. and pulling back its forces from south Korea.
 Recalling that GIs deliberately drove over and killed Kim Myong Ja, a woman in her fifties when crossing a road in Tongduchon of Kyonggi Province in June, the statement accused the U.S. forces of letting these criminals go unpunished.    
 It is hardly understandable for the U.S. forces to have ruled that the killers are not guilty without staging a formal trial of them, and it is an act of letting the criminals go scot-free as they did when handling the case of the murder of the two schoolgirls by GIs and fooling the Koreans, it said.
 The people can never exercise any sovereignty as long as the humiliating and unfair SOFA remains in force, the statement deplored, urging the U.S. military authorities to abandon the jurisdiction and transfer the criminals to the court of south Korea.

Message of Sympathy to Indian President
Gift to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Indian President
    Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of sympathy to Indian President A. P. J. Abdul Kalam in connection with explosions in New Delhi that claimed big casualties.
 The message expressed deep sympathy and condolences to the Indian president and, through him, to the victims and the bereaved families and conviction that the Indian government and people would eradicate the aftermath of the incidents and achieve social stability as early as possible.

Gift to Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by a delegation of the National Integrated Study and Research Centre of Nepal on a visit to the DPRK.
 It was conveyed to an official concerned by its Chief Adviser Kamal Prasad Chaulagain who is heading the delegation.
